meanings.definition: The apparent displacement of an object due to a change in the observer's position.
meanings.sent1: The parallaxes of the stars can be observed when looking at them from different locations.
meanings.sent2: Astronomers study the parallaxes of celestial bodies to understand their distances from Earth.
meanings.sent3: The alien claimed their spaceship had special glasses to see parallaxes in time.
meanings.sent4: In the artist's painting, the parallaxes of the buildings created a sense of depth and movement.
meanings.sent5: The parallaxes of the mountains against the sunset painted a breathtaking scene.

meanings.definition: The difference in the apparent position of an object when viewed from two different points.
meanings.sent1: The parallaxes of the tree looked different when seen from the park and the street.
meanings.sent2: Hunters use the parallaxes of their prey to calculate the best shooting angle.
meanings.sent3: The detective solved the case by noticing the parallaxes in the suspect's alibi.
meanings.sent4: The parallaxes of the cars on the highway created a mesmerizing optical illusion.
meanings.sent5: The parallaxes of the clouds made them appear to be moving at different speeds.
